title: Wild Rice Pilaf
ingredients: 1 cup wild rice, well rinsed and drained
1 tablespoon minced fresh sage leaves or 1½ teaspoons crumbled dried
2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves or 1 teaspoon crumbled dried
2 cups chicken stock or canned chicken broth, hot
½ cup pine nuts, toasted lightly
instructions: In a flameproof casserole cook the onion in the butter over moderately low heat, stirring, until it is softened.  Add the wild rice and cook the mixture, stirring, for 5 minutes.  Add the sage, the thyme, salt and pepper to taste, and continue cooking the mixture, stirring, for 1 minute, at the end of which add the heated chicken stock.  The mixture may be prepared to this point one hour ahead and kept covered at room temperature.
Bake the mixture, covered, in a preheated 350° F., oven for one hour, or until the rice is just tender.  Just before serving, add the pine nuts to the pilaf and toss it well.
Source:  Gourmet Menus, Elegant Autumn Dinners, Gourmet Magazine, October 1984.
